intro: Adoniastrum vernale, commonly known as spring adonia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polemoniaceae. It is native to the western United States and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and rocky slopes, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Adoniastrum vernale is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
